properties.areaDesc: Waters from South Santee River SC to Edisto Beach SC extending from 20 nm to 40 nm; Coastal waters from South Santee River to Edisto Beach SC out 20 nm
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 13 at 6:09PM EST by NWS Charleston SC
properties.description:
At 609 PM EST, thunderstorms were located along a line extending from
Rattlesnake Shoal to near Joe Shuford Reef, moving northeast at 55
knots.

HAZARD...Winds up to 30 knots.

IMPACT...Expect briefly stronger winds and suddenly higher waves.
Put on a personal flotation device.

Marine locations impacted through 715 PM EST include:
Capers Island Buoy...             Hector Reef...
Capers Reef...                    Bull Breakers...
Charleston Nearshore Reef...      Charleston Coastal Anglers...
Cape Romain Reef...               Air Force Reef...
Jimmy Leland Tug...               Rattlesnake Shoal...
properties.instruction:
Mariners can expect gusty winds to around 30 knots, locally higher
waves, lightning strikes, and poor visibility in heavy rain. Boaters
should seek safe harbor immediately until these storms pass.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS THUNDERSTORMS IMPACTING THE COASTAL WATERS
